<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Today, Disney is launching its streaming service, Disney+, and we are launching Morning Brew+ to cover the historic release.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What you can expect: </strong></span><span>A story each day this week exploring what Disney+ means for the company, the industry, and entertainment more broadly.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A brand new <em>Business Casual </em>podcast episode with the GOAT of streaming analysis: </strong></span><span>Matt Ball, the former global head of strategy at Amazon Studios. After listening to Ball, you’ll never think the same way about TV again.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Listen on <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Ball_Apple?sailthru_lists[{u(%22podcast1%22)}]=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Ball_Spotify?sailthru_lists[{u(%22podcast1%22)}]=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Ball_All?sailthru_lists[{u(%22podcast1%22)}]=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney Adds a Streaming Service
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Streaming wars " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTA5MDM5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This story is part of our five-piece series about the streaming wars. Check out our other features on </em><em>the </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>history</em></a><em> of Disney, the </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/streaming-subscription-costs-dollarsheres?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>business model</em></a><em> of content delivery, the future of </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/future-sports-live-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>sports</em></a><em> broadcasts, and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/whats-next-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what's next</a> for streaming.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On this day, Nov. 12, 2019, World War Stream began. Netflix and Apple had a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/31/apple-tv-launches-streaming-wars-heat?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skirmish</a> earlier this month, but now Disney's joined the fight with its own streaming platform, Disney+, backed up by battalions of Avengers, Stormtroopers, and Buzz Lightyears.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The origin story </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2005, Bob Iger took over as CEO as the "safe-but-dull" choice...though his tenure has been <a href="https://www.newstatesman.com/robert-iger-disney-ceo-ride-lifetime-autobiography-review?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">anything but</a>. He took Disney on a series of 10-figure adventures, including acquisitions of Pixar (2006), Marvel (2009), Lucasfilm (2012), and 21st Century Fox assets (2019). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><span>The cumulative price tag for those deals: $87 billion</span></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But nobody was saying "Disney and chill" (granted, it is known for kids movies). So Iger set out to build Disney a platform to distribute its world-leading content. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2017, Disney bought </span><span><span>full control of</span></span><span> streaming company BAMTech to help build that platform. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Fox acquisition gave it a controlling stake in Hulu, which it's offering in a </span><span><a href="https://www.cordcuttersnews.com/disney-announces-new-details-about-its-12-99-bundle-with-hulu-espn/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bundle</a></span><span> with Disney+ and ESPN+.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At launch, Disney+ has distribution <a href="https://www.fool.com/earnings/call-transcripts/2019/11/07/walt-disney-company-dis-q4-2019-earnings-call-tran.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partnerships</a> with Apple, Google, Microsoft, <span>Amazon, and more</span>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why this could work</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For $6.99/month, users get access to 500+ movies and 7,500+ TV episodes. Within five years, that'll grow to 620+ and 10,000+, respectively. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To build that library, Disney's spent the last two years pulling content from other platforms (losing out on hundreds of millions in licensing fees). It's betting <a href="https://redef.com/original/nine-reasons-why-disney-will-succeed-and-why-four-criticisms-are-overhyped?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fans will follow</a> their favorite franchises to the greener pastures of Disney+. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fact: fans follow franchises. </strong>Don’t tell <span>Scorsese</span>, but since <span>2015</span> the top two movies at the <a href="https://www.boxofficemojo.com/year/world/2019/?grossesOption=totalGrosses&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">global box office</a> each year have been Star Wars or Marvel features. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With new superhero content exclusive to Disney+, Disney is betting fans will pay to stay ahead of story arcs.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Disney+ is also launching </span><span><em>The <span>Mandalorian</span></em></span><span>, the first live-action Star Wars TV series.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The outlook</strong>, per <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-11-07/inside-disney-bob-iger-on-star-wars-pixar-and-more?srnd=businessweek-v2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a>: "The consensus now is that Disney+ will easily meet its hopes for 90 million subscribers globally by 2024, and that ESPN+ and Hulu will add to their totals, bringing the company to as many as 160 million streaming customers." </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/kkr-formally-approaches-walgreens-buyout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Walgreens Keeps the Party LBO-ing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Washington Nationals celebrating " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fxCIyA6rC2UtQNGJvT/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Washington Nationals celebrating " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fxCIyA6rC2UtQNGJvT/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fresh off its World Series championship, Walgreens Boots Alliance has reportedly been <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-11/kkr-said-to-make-formal-approach-to-walgreens-on-record-buyout?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">formally approached</a> by private equity giant KKR about taking the pharmacy chain private.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It would be the biggest leveraged buyout ever. </strong>Walgreens is worth more than $55 billion and has $16.8 billion in debt. With a premium to butter up Walgreens’s shareholders, KKR’s bid could easily top the current take-private record of ~$45 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It would be a giant red W for Walgreens.</strong> Whereas rival CVS acquired health insurer Aetna to become a vertically integrated one-stop healthcare shop, Walgreens has <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucejapsen/2019/11/11/kkr-may-take-lead-in-walgreens-buyout/#60b8061d3053?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kept its focus</a> on in-store retail.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Investors </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/9824af60-049d-11ea-a984-fbbacad9e7dd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don’t love</a></span><span> that strategy, especially with Amazon </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/11/investing/walgreens-kkr-buyout-report/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nipping</a></span><span> at Walgreens’s heels. Walgreens shares are down 8.5% in 2019.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It would be hard to justify the math.</strong> Walgreens projects “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/28/walgreens-boots-alliance-wba-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roughly flat</a>” earnings for the 2020 fiscal year. Its retail-first attitude hasn’t generated the meaty profits private equity firms typically target. And last week, private equity rival Stephen Schwarzman of Blackstone said a Walgreens buyout was a “stretch.”</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/tmobile-ceo-reportedly-talks-lead-wework?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Next CEO of WeWork Could Be Lege—Wait for It—re
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="John Legere " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTEzNzIyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>John Moore/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork, the Icarus of the almost-public class of 2019, is reportedly in talks with T-Mobile CEO John Legere to lead the company now that eccentric co-founder Adam Neumann is all but excommunicated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">WeWork needs:</strong> an adult in the room. Fresh off a nearly $10 billion SoftBank bailout last month, the company is looking for a seasoned vet who can possibly take the company public in the future. It wants someone to join as soon as January, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-in-talks-to-hire-t-mobile-ceo-john-legere-11573494028?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Legere has: </strong>the chops. In six years at T-Mobile, Legere <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/11/20959635/wework-john-legere-ceo-discussions-tmobile-report?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled the company</a> from a distant fourth place among U.S. wireless carriers to third. Then, he brokered a pending merger with Sprint. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He also fulfills the WeWork CEO’s only two </span><span><em>real</em></span><span> job requirements—fantastic hair and an affinity for brightly colored t-shirts.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And that about sums up his personality. Legere’s been called a “trash-talking executive” with “a pugnacious style” and an “<a href="http://bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-11/wework-seeks-a-new-ceo-and-has-talked-with-t-mobile-s-legere?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unpredictable</a> and antagonistic public persona.” But we’ll wait until Legere struts barefoot through NYC to call him Neumann 2.0.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/spacex-launches-60-starlink-satellites?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Another Round for the SpaceX Table
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SpaceX launch " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTAwOTM2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Productivity gurus tell us to reduce big tasks into small, manageable chunks. When your big task is to provide internet connection to the entire world, that means sending 60 satellites into the stratosphere. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, SpaceX <a href="https://www.cnn.com/videos/business/2019/11/11/spacex-satellites-starlink-orig.cnn-business/video/playlists/business-spacex/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> its second round of internet-beaming <span>Starlink satellites in under a year</span>. The company has <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/11/11/778219787/as-spacex-launches-dozens-of-satellites-at-a-time-some-fear-an-orbital-traffic-j?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans</a> for 24 more launches next year and eventually hopes to blanket the sky with 30,000 satellites. After yesterday, it's got <span>around</span> 120 in orbit. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As any cheerleader can tell you, the base is just as important as the flyers. The reusable SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket booster made its </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/11/watch-spacex-livestream-launching-second-starlink-internet-mission.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fourth landing</a></span><span> yesterday, a milestone for the company. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> In 2012, SpaceX’s board realized its flashier business—rocket launches—made peanuts compared to commercial satellites. CEO Elon Musk estimated Starlink could generate 10x what the launch business can muster. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One group that isn’t cheering: </strong>astronomers. The NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/11/science/spacex-starlink-satellites.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a> they’re worried that the satellites might affect their ability to stargaze and conduct #science. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>SpaceX said it would try to mitigate any problems, even offering to </span><span><span>paint the Earth-facing bases of the satellites</span></span><span> black. But scientists still think they’ll confuse telescopes.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-COMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/singles-day-stats-make-go-wow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stats That Make You Go "Wow"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="guy going "wow"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/SDogLD4FOZMM8/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='guy going "wow"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/SDogLD4FOZMM8/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chinese e-commerce leader Alibaba reported a record <strong style="color:#000"><em>$38.3 billion</em></strong> in gross merchandise volume (GMV) sold on <a href="https://qz.com/1746291/alibabas-singles-day-tops-38-billion-amid-trade-tensions-protests/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Singles Day</a>. Or as we Brew writers like to call it, every day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Let’s put that in perspective. </strong>$38 billion is a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/11/alibaba-singles-day-2019-record-sales-on-biggest-shopping-day.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">26% increase</a> from last year’s Singles Day shopping extravaganza. It’s also more than 5x what Amazon sold during its 48-hour Prime Day event in July and about 10x the size of Burundi’s economy.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GMV topped $12 billion in the first hour of sales. Within 90 minutes, Alibaba's sales beat the total from Singles Day 2016.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. was the second-largest seller to China by GMV.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But GMV is kind of a mess.</strong> The metric is supposed to illustrate the total value of orders on Alibaba’s platforms. But the numbers go unaudited, there’s no standard measurement, and Alibaba’s Singles Day <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/11/technology/alibaba-singles-day.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financial metrics</a> have been the target of U.S. regulators before.</p>

PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/risk-business-casual-takes-streaming-wars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Risk It All: <em>Business Casual</em> Takes on the Streaming Wars
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="business casual logo " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTEwNzQ2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Int. Morning Brew office, editorial team weekly check-in:</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">[Writer 1] </strong>Question: What kind of streaming service is best?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">[Writer 2]</strong> That’s a ridiculous question.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">[Writer 1] </strong>False. Black bear.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Any fan of <em>The Office </em>recognizes that reference. And any fan of business news knows the streaming wars are fundamentally changing the way you watch TV.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today on Morning Brew’s weekly podcast, </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">,</strong> we pick apart what’s made the streaming wars just that—wars, from Disney to Netflix, Apple to Amazon. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How have subscriber counts, ad dollars, and content spend contributed to the most thrilling business battle of the decade? Matt Ball, verified media guru and former global head of strategy for Amazon Studios, has the answers. Plus...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How Amazon has impacted the media landscape.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When we’ll know who owns the future of streaming.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why Netflix is still the one to beat.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen now:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Ball_Apple?sailthru_lists[{u(%22podcast1%22)}]=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Ball_Spotify?sailthru_lists[{u(%22podcast1%22)}]=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Ball_All?sailthru_lists[{u(%22podcast1%22)}]=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Everywhere else</a></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/11/boeing-expects-to-resume-737-max-deliveries-in-december.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Boeing</a></span><span> said the grounded 737 Max could restart commercial service in January. Shares gained </span><span><span>nearly </span></span><span>5% on the news.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-s-secret-project-nightingale-gathers-personal-health-data-on-millions-of-americans-11573496790?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google’s “Project Nightingale”</a></span><span> is reportedly collecting troves of personal health data from </span><span><span>millions of consumers</span></span><span> in 21 states.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/faa-considered-grounding-some-southwest-jets-over-maintenance-concerns-11573492428?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Southwest</a></span><span> allegedly flies over three dozen jets without being able to prove they are in keeping with mandatory federal safety standards, the WSJ reports.</span>
</li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If there’s one thing we ask Brew readers today...</strong>it <em>has </em>to be about which NFL team Jeff Bezos should buy. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTA5MDM5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis story is part of our five-piece series about the streaming wars. Check out our other features on \u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003ethe \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ehistory\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e of Disney, the \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/streaming-subscription-costs-dollarsheres?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ebusiness model\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e of content delivery, the future of \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/future-sports-live-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003esports\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e broadcasts, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/whats-next-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhat's next\u003c/a\u003e for streaming.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn this day, Nov. 12, 2019, World War Stream began. Netflix and Apple had a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/31/apple-tv-launches-streaming-wars-heat?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eskirmish\u003c/a\u003e earlier this month, but now Disney's joined the fight with its own streaming platform, Disney+, backed up by battalions of Avengers, Stormtroopers, and Buzz Lightyears.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe origin story \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2005, Bob Iger took over as CEO as the \"safe-but-dull\" choice...though his tenure has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.newstatesman.com/robert-iger-disney-ceo-ride-lifetime-autobiography-review?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanything but\u003c/a\u003e. He took Disney on a series of 10-figure adventures, including acquisitions of Pixar (2006), Marvel (2009), Lucasfilm (2012), and 21st Century Fox assets (2019). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe cumulative price tag for those deals: $87 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut nobody was saying \"Disney and chill\" (granted, it is known for kids movies). So Iger set out to build Disney a platform to distribute its world-leading content. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn 2017, Disney bought \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003efull control of\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e streaming company BAMTech to help build that platform. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Fox acquisition gave it a controlling stake in Hulu, which it's offering in a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cordcuttersnews.com/disney-announces-new-details-about-its-12-99-bundle-with-hulu-espn/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebundle\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with Disney+ and ESPN+.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt launch, Disney+ has distribution \u003ca href=\"https://www.fool.com/earnings/call-transcripts/2019/11/07/walt-disney-company-dis-q4-2019-earnings-call-tran.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epartnerships\u003c/a\u003e with Apple, Google, Microsoft, \u003cspan\u003eAmazon, and more\u003c/span\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy this could work\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor $6.99/month, users get access to 500+ movies and 7,500+ TV episodes. Within five years, that'll grow to 620+ and 10,000+, respectively. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo build that library, Disney's spent the last two years pulling content from other platforms (losing out on hundreds of millions in licensing fees). It's betting \u003ca href=\"https://redef.com/original/nine-reasons-why-disney-will-succeed-and-why-four-criticisms-are-overhyped?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efans will follow\u003c/a\u003e their favorite franchises to the greener pastures of Disney+. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFact: fans follow franchises. \u003c/strong\u003eDon’t tell \u003cspan\u003eScorsese\u003c/span\u003e, but since \u003cspan\u003e2015\u003c/span\u003e the top two movies at the \u003ca href=\"https://www.boxofficemojo.com/year/world/2019/?grossesOption=totalGrosses\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eglobal box office\u003c/a\u003e each year have been Star Wars or Marvel features. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith new superhero content exclusive to Disney+, Disney is betting fans will pay to stay ahead of story arcs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDisney+ is also launching \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe \u003cspan\u003eMandalorian\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the first live-action Star Wars TV series.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe outlook\u003c/strong\u003e, per \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-11-07/inside-disney-bob-iger-on-star-wars-pixar-and-more?srnd=businessweek-v2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg\u003c/a\u003e: \"The consensus now is that Disney+ will easily meet its hopes for 90 million subscribers globally by 2024, and that ESPN+ and Hulu will add to their totals, bringing the company to as many as 160 million streaming customers.\" \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFresh off its World Series championship, Walgreens Boots Alliance has reportedly been \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-11/kkr-said-to-make-formal-approach-to-walgreens-on-record-buyout?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eformally approached\u003c/a\u003e by private equity giant KKR about taking the pharmacy chain private.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt would be the biggest leveraged buyout ever. \u003c/strong\u003eWalgreens is worth more than $55 billion and has $16.8 billion in debt. With a premium to butter up Walgreens’s shareholders, KKR’s bid could easily top the current take-private record of ~$45 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt would be a giant red W for Walgreens.\u003c/strong\u003e Whereas rival CVS acquired health insurer Aetna to become a vertically integrated one-stop healthcare shop, Walgreens has \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucejapsen/2019/11/11/kkr-may-take-lead-in-walgreens-buyout/#60b8061d3053?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekept its focus\u003c/a\u003e on in-store retail.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eInvestors \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/9824af60-049d-11ea-a984-fbbacad9e7dd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon’t love\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that strategy, especially with Amazon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/11/investing/walgreens-kkr-buyout-report/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enipping\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at Walgreens’s heels. Walgreens shares are down 8.5% in 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt would be hard to justify the math.\u003c/strong\u003e Walgreens projects “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/28/walgreens-boots-alliance-wba-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eroughly flat\u003c/a\u003e” earnings for the 2020 fiscal year. Its retail-first attitude hasn’t generated the meaty profits private equity firms typically target. And last week, private equity rival Stephen Schwarzman of Blackstone said a Walgreens buyout was a “stretch.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWeWork, the Icarus of the almost-public class of 2019, is reportedly in talks with T-Mobile CEO John Legere to lead the company now that eccentric co-founder Adam Neumann is all but excommunicated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWeWork needs:\u003c/strong\u003e an adult in the room. Fresh off a nearly $10 billion SoftBank bailout last month, the company is looking for a seasoned vet who can possibly take the company public in the future. It wants someone to join as soon as January, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-in-talks-to-hire-t-mobile-ceo-john-legere-11573494028?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLegere has: \u003c/strong\u003ethe chops. In six years at T-Mobile, Legere \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/11/20959635/wework-john-legere-ceo-discussions-tmobile-report?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled the company\u003c/a\u003e from a distant fourth place among U.S. wireless carriers to third. Then, he brokered a pending merger with Sprint. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe also fulfills the WeWork CEO’s only two \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ereal\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e job requirements—fantastic hair and an affinity for brightly colored t-shirts.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd that about sums up his personality. Legere’s been called a “trash-talking executive” with “a pugnacious style” and an “\u003ca href=\"http://bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-11/wework-seeks-a-new-ceo-and-has-talked-with-t-mobile-s-legere?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunpredictable\u003c/a\u003e and antagonistic public persona.” But we’ll wait until Legere struts barefoot through NYC to call him Neumann 2.0.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eProductivity gurus tell us to reduce big tasks into small, manageable chunks. When your big task is to provide internet connection to the entire world, that means sending 60 satellites into the stratosphere. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, SpaceX \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/videos/business/2019/11/11/spacex-satellites-starlink-orig.cnn-business/video/playlists/business-spacex/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e its second round of internet-beaming \u003cspan\u003eStarlink satellites in under a year\u003c/span\u003e. The company has \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/11/11/778219787/as-spacex-launches-dozens-of-satellites-at-a-time-some-fear-an-orbital-traffic-j?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplans\u003c/a\u003e for 24 more launches next year and eventually hopes to blanket the sky with 30,000 satellites. After yesterday, it's got \u003cspan\u003earound\u003c/span\u003e 120 in orbit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs any cheerleader can tell you, the base is just as important as the flyers. The reusable SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket booster made its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/11/watch-spacex-livestream-launching-second-starlink-internet-mission.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efourth landing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday, a milestone for the company. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e In 2012, SpaceX’s board realized its flashier business—rocket launches—made peanuts compared to commercial satellites. CEO Elon Musk estimated Starlink could generate 10x what the launch business can muster. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne group that isn’t cheering: \u003c/strong\u003eastronomers. The NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/11/science/spacex-starlink-satellites.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e they’re worried that the satellites might affect their ability to stargaze and conduct #science. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSpaceX said it would try to mitigate any problems, even offering to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003epaint the Earth-facing bases of the satellites\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e black. But scientists still think they’ll confuse telescopes.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChinese e-commerce leader Alibaba reported a record \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e$38.3 billion\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e in gross merchandise volume (GMV) sold on \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1746291/alibabas-singles-day-tops-38-billion-amid-trade-tensions-protests/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSingles Day\u003c/a\u003e. Or as we Brew writers like to call it, every day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLet’s put that in perspective. \u003c/strong\u003e$38 billion is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/11/alibaba-singles-day-2019-record-sales-on-biggest-shopping-day.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e26% increase\u003c/a\u003e from last year’s Singles Day shopping extravaganza. It’s also more than 5x what Amazon sold during its 48-hour Prime Day event in July and about 10x the size of Burundi’s economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGMV topped $12 billion in the first hour of sales. Within 90 minutes, Alibaba's sales beat the total from Singles Day 2016.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. was the second-largest seller to China by GMV.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut GMV is kind of a mess.\u003c/strong\u003e The metric is supposed to illustrate the total value of orders on Alibaba’s platforms. But the numbers go unaudited, there’s no standard measurement, and Alibaba’s Singles Day \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/11/technology/alibaba-singles-day.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinancial metrics\u003c/a\u003e have been the target of U.S. regulators
